meanings.definition: To reverse the twisting or winding of something.
meanings.sent1: She was untwisting the rope to make it straight again.
meanings.sent2: He carefully untwisted the wire to fix the connection.
meanings.sent3: The cat was untwisting the yarn, thinking it was a fun game.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like untwisting a tangled web of lies.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick involved untwisting a metal ring into two separate pieces.

meanings.definition: The act of straightening or undoing a twist in something.
meanings.sent1: The untwisting of the rubber band revealed its true length.
meanings.sent2: His untwisting of the story clarified the misunderstanding.
meanings.sent3: The untwisting of the plot in the movie was unexpected but satisfying.
meanings.sent4: The untwisting of the balloon animal left it looking deflated and sad.
meanings.sent5: The untwisting of the old clock's spring brought it back to life with a tick-tock rhythm.
